required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Non-inferiority Study of Unresectable Hepatocelluar Carcinoma Receiving Stereotactic Radiotherapy Combined With Hepatic Arterial Chemoembolization Compared With Conversion Hepatectomy
clinical_study.official_title: Non-inferiority Study of Unresectable Hepatocelluar Carcinoma Receiving Stereotactic Radiotherapy Combined With Hepatic Arterial Chemoembolization Compared With Conversion Hepatectomy

brief_summary.textblock: To compare the prognosis and adverse reactions of unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma receiving stereotactic radiotherapy combined with hepatic arterial chemoembolization and conversion hepatectomy

primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomization until the date of death from any cause, assessed up to 24 months.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomization until the date of disease progression or date of death from any cause, whichever came first, assessed up to 24 months.
From the date of radiotherapy completion until the 4 months after therapy,up to 6 months.
From the date of radiotherapy completion until the 4 months after therapy,up to 6 months

arm_group.arm_group_label: Conversion hepatectomy after CK-SBRT plus TACE

study_pop.textblock: Unresectable HCC patients meet surgical criteria after CK-SBRT plus TACE.
